page.title: 06Mowsley Primary school
page.content: The school(built 1864) has 21 pupils who share 2 classrooms,2 teachers and 3 outside toilets.They are taught in 3 age groups by the team-teaching method ;2 groups usually in 1 room doing more formal work,and 1 in the smaller room with practical work,T.V,computer,music etc.All the children have weekly swimming lessons,play rounders,visit the larger schools,and follow the usual curriculum.The older children go to Husband's Bosworth for football and netball,and the Rector takes them for Bible studies. School hours are from 9.0 am. to 12 am.and from 1.15pm to 3.15pm,with a 20 minute break at 10.30.Games of tig and ball are played in the{playground ; a climbing frame is used in summer. The older children have{clubs}for nature,French and games at{lunchtime. are no cooked meals.
